histogram.name: Variations.AppSeedFreshness
histogram.summary: The time interval between when a WebView-using app's copy of the variations seed was written to its local app storage and when it was loaded for use. This is different from Variations.SeedFreshness because it measures freshness from when the app received its copy of the seed, not when the seed was originally downloaded. Written every time the browser process initializes, but not if there was an error reading the seed, or no seed existed.

histogram.name: Variations.AppSeedRequestState
histogram.summary: The result of checking if a WebView-using app's copy of the variations seed is still fresh, or if a new seed should be requested.

histogram.name: Variations.CreateTrials.SeedExpiry
histogram.summary: The result of verifying if the variations seed is expired, recorded before trials are created from the seed. Expired seeds are treated as not existing.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRun.SeedConnectTime
histogram.summary: The latency of connection to the variations server when fetching an initial variations seed during Android Chrome first run. This is included in the Variations.FirstRun.SeedFetchTime measurement. Only considers cases where an HTTP 200 result was received.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRun.SeedFetchResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to fetch an initial variations seed during Android Chrome first run. Records both the HTTP code and various error values in one enumeration.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRun.SeedFetchTime
histogram.summary: The latency of fetching an initial variations seed during Android Chrome first run. Only considers cases where an HTTP 200 result was received.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRunPrefsDebug
histogram.summary: Logs each event related to Android Chrome variations first run prefs to debug crbug.com/1090968.

histogram.name: Variations.FirstRunResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to import an initial variations seed during Android Chrome first run. Logged from VariationsSeedStore::LoadSeed when seed prefs do not exist.

histogram.name: Variations.Headers.DomainOwner
histogram.summary: The owner of the top-level domain from which certain subframe-initiated HTTP requests are made. It's logged after determining that (i) the request should include variations headers, (ii) the request is from a subframe, and (iii) TrustedParams are not present. It's logged before adding headers. It allows us to verify whether non-render-thread-initiated requests, if any, lack TrustedParams.

histogram.name: Variations.Headers.ExperimentCount
histogram.summary: Records number of experiment ids in the X-Client-Data header at the time the header is constructed.

histogram.name: Variations.Headers.RequestContextCategory
histogram.summary: Details about the request context in which an HTTP request is made. Logged after determining that the request should include variations headers but before adding the headers.

histogram.name: Variations.Headers.URLValidationResult{VariationsHeadersURLValidationResult}
histogram.summary: The result of whether to append Variations headers to a request. Logged when when determining (i) whether the URL to which the request is being sent should have a variations header and (ii) whether--after a redirect--the request to which a variations header was added should have the variations header removed. {VariationsHeadersURLValidationResult}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

variant.name: .Append
variant.summary: Result when checking whether to append a header.

variant.name: .Remove
variant.summary: Result when checking whether to remove a header.

histogram.name: Variations.LoadPermanentConsistencyCountryResult
histogram.summary: Records how the country code saved in prefs used for filtering permanent consistency studies compares to the country code in the variations seed. This is recorded each time the saved country code is loaded from the pref.

histogram.name: Variations.LoadSeedSignature
histogram.summary: The result of verifying the latest variations seed's signature, recorded when the seed is loaded from Local State. Not recorded when running in safe mode.

histogram.name: Variations.PolicyRestriction
histogram.summary: Records the restrictions on how experiment variations are applied on the client. This is recorded at start up.

histogram.name: Variations.RequestCount
histogram.summary: Number of previous requests to the variations server in the same session, logged each time a new request is attempted to the variations server. For example, the value of the 0th bucket indicates the number of initial requests to the server that took place.

histogram.name: Variations.ResourceRequestsAllowed
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the VariationsService is allowed or not allowed to make a request due to the ResourceRequestAllowedNotifier. Useful for debugging cases where variations seeds may not be getting fetched.

histogram.name: Variations.SafeMode.FellBackToSafeMode2
histogram.summary: Whether or not the VariationsService fell back to Safe Mode, due to either too many crashes or too many failures to fetch a new seed. Recorded during Chrome startup, immediately before field trials are created. Only recorded if either a recent or a safe seed was loaded successfully.

histogram.name: Variations.SafeMode.LoadSafeSeed.Result
histogram.summary: Records whether the safe variations seed was successfully read from local state on startup. Records a detailed reason on read failure. Only recorded when attempting to run in safe mode.

histogram.name: Variations.SafeMode.LoadSafeSeed.SignatureValidity
histogram.summary: The result of verifying the safe variations seed's signature, recorded when the seed is loaded from Local State. Only recorded when attempting to run in safe mode.

histogram.name: Variations.SafeMode.StoreSafeSeed.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of storing a safe variations seed (and all associated metadata) to the seed store.

histogram.name: Variations.SafeMode.StoreSafeSeed.SignatureValidity
histogram.summary: The result of verifying the safe variations seed's signature, recorded when the safe seed is stored to Local State.

histogram.name: Variations.SafeMode.Streak.Crashes
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive crashes observed by the VariationsService, without a single intervening successful seed fetch. Recorded during Chrome startup, when the VariationsService is created.

histogram.name: Variations.SafeMode.Streak.FetchFailures
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive failed attempts to fetch a new seed by the VariationsService. Recorded during Chrome startup, when the VariationsService is created.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateChange
histogram.summary: Counts if a response from the variations server is the first response of the day or not. This is counted when a new valid seed or a 304 is received. The date line is computed in UTC and the times being compared are the server time from the server response and the stored server time from the last successful request.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFetchResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes and network error encountered by VariationsService when attempting to fetch a variations seed from the server over an HTTPS connection.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFetchResponseOrErrorCode.HTTP
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes and network error encountered by VariationsService when attempting to fetch a variations seed from the server over an HTTP connection.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFreshness
histogram.summary: The time interval between when the variations seed was downloaded and when it was loaded for use. Not recorded for expired seeds, nor when the download time is unknown (typically, for seeds imported via first run).

histogram.name: Variations.SeedLoadBlockingTime
histogram.summary: Records the time spent blocking WebView startup to wait for the variations seed. This is less than the entire time needed to load the seed, since startup is only blocked if loading is not complete by the time the seed is needed. This would ideally have a maximum value equal to the timeout in VariationsSeedLoader, but there is no actual limit on how late that timeout could fire. This is logged once per WebView startup, whether or not loading the seed was successful.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedLoadResult
histogram.summary: Records whether the latest variations seed was successfully read from local state on startup. Records a detailed reason on read failure. Not recorded when running in safe mode.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedProcessingTime
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes to load and process variations seed. This metric is recorded only when loading and processing of the seed is successful.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedStoreResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of storing the variations seed that was received from the server. Also logs the types of data received (gzip, delta, etc).

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.Duration
histogram.summary:
Records the time taken to perform variations seed simulation.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.KillBestEffortChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "kill best effort" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.KillCriticalChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "kill critical" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.SimulateSeed.NormalChanges
histogram.summary:
Records the result of variations seed simulation. Logs the number of experiment groups in the "normal" category that are expected to change on a restart of the browser with the received seed.
Recorded on every variation seed simulation, which follows a fetch.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.DataSize
histogram.summary: The size of the variations seed data, which may be a partial (delta) or compressed (gzip) payload, see Variations.SeedStoreResult.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeedSignature
histogram.summary: The result of verifying the variations seed signature, recorded when the variations seed is stored to Local State after being retrieved from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.StringsOverridden
histogram.summary: Records the number of UI strings overriden for each study that overrides strings. Recorded at start up when each study is evaluated.

histogram.name: Variations.TimeSinceLastFetchAttempt
histogram.summary: The time since the previous attempt to fetch the variations seed within the same session, with 0 indicating that this is the first attempt. Recorded when a variations seed fetch is attempted by the VariationsService.

histogram.name: Variations.UserChannel
histogram.summary: Log the user channel assigned at browser startup used for evaluating the variations seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.WebViewDownloadJobFetchResult
histogram.summary: The result of a WebView seed download. Records both the HTTP code and various error values in one enumeration.

histogram.name: Variations.WebViewDownloadJobFetchTime2
histogram.summary: The duration of the network request to downloads a new WebView variations seed from the variations server to the central on-device service.

histogram.name: Variations.WebViewDownloadJobInterval
histogram.summary: The time between the start of two consecutive WebView seed downloads by WebView's service. This metric will not be written if seeds are never downloaded.

histogram.name: Variations.WebViewDownloadJobQueueTime
histogram.summary: The delay between when a WebView seed download was scheduled by the service with the JobScheduler and when it was executed.
